page.title: 11WIMBLEBALL SAILING CLUB
page.content: This club used to sail on Clatworthy Reservoir but move here when Wimbleball was completed. The club has some 285 members (this includes family membership) and there are also 90 school members. Membership of the club costs less than Â£20 a year which makes it one of the cheapest in the country. The sailing is excellent because the hills on either side of the lake are not too steep to act as wind breaks. The boats sailed there include lasers, solos, toppers, kestrels, marks, enterprises and otters and there are also some catamarans. The membership comes mainly from the surrounding counties but some live as far afield as London but have holiday cottages in the area. They had an open meeting at Easter attracting entries from a large area.
